Before C++11, this language has only two kinds of value: lvalue and rvalue. And only lvalue has reference.
lvalue: lvalue is an object that can get its address like variable and array.
rvalue: rvalue is an object that can't get its address like literal and temporary variable.
C++11 adds the rvalue reference, we can use Type&& to make a rvalue reference. Rvalue reference binds the rvalue object rather than copy it, while the object that be binded will be destoryed.
